title: How to Lock an iPhone or Android Screen for Kids: Step-by-Step

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings . Guided Access allows you to lock your device on a specific app or screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and select Accessibility.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Accessibility . The icon has a blue background with a white icon of a person surrounded by a circle. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and select Guided Access.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Guided Access . The icon has a gray background with a white lock icon surrounded by a dotted line square. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle on Guided Access.
steps.content: Toggle on Guided Access. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Passcode Settings.
steps.content: Tap Passcode Settings . You'll want to set a passcode or use Face ID so you can adjust your Guided Access settings while it is active or to disable it. [5] X Research source If you'd like to set a passcode, tap Set Guided Access Passcode . You can then enter the desired passcode twice to set it up. If you'd like to use Face ID, simply toggle on the Face ID setting.

steps.title: Tap the Back button and toggle on Accessibility Shortcut.
steps.content: Tap the Back button and toggle on Accessibility Shortcut. This will allow you to use the side button to enable and configure your Guided Access settings.

steps.title: Navigate to the app you want your child to use.
steps.content: Navigate to the app you want your child to use. This could be a game or even a specific YouTube video.

steps.title: Click the side button three times.
steps.content: Click the side button three times. The Guided Access menu will appear. [6] X Research source Note that this menu only appears the first time you set Guided Access on an app. Subsequent times will automatically apply your Guided Access settings from your last time using Guided Access, but you can click the side button three times and enter your Guided Access passcode to edit your settings.

steps.title: Select Options at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Select Options at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Toggle on or off the settings you want to adjust.
steps.content: Toggle on or off the settings you want to adjust. By default, Side Button , Volume Buttons and Time Limit are toggled off, and Motion , Software Keyboards and Touch are toggled on. [7] X Research source To allow your child to have full use of the app without exiting it, leave the default settings alone. If you only want your child to have access to a particular screen, toggle off Touch . This will make it so they cannot use any gestures to exit the screen.

steps.title: Tap Done at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap Done at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Circle areas on the screen you want to disable.
steps.content: Circle areas on the screen you want to disable. You can use your finger to select areas on the screen you want to disable if you don't want to disable touch for the entire screen. After drawing a selection, you can move it by dragging it, adjust the selection size using the handles on the corners, or remove it by tapping the X button in the upper-left corner of the selection. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Start in the upper right.
steps.content: Tap Start in the upper right. [9] X Research source To end Guided Access, simply click the side button three times, enter your passcode, and tap End in the upper-left corner. If you are using Face ID instead of a passcode, tap the side button twice instead of three times. If your iPhone is not an iPhone X, XR, 11, 12, 13, or 14, you will need to tap the home button instead of the side button.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings . Android can pin apps, which is similar to Guided Access but with fewer features. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Select Security, Security & location, or Biometrics and security.
steps.content: Select Security , Security & location , or Biometrics and security . As each Android device is slightly different, locating these settings may be in a slightly different spot.

steps.title: Select Advanced or Other security settings.
steps.content: Select Advanced or Other security settings . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap App pinning and turn it on.
steps.content: Tap App pinning and turn it on. When app pinning is on, you'll need to enter your device PIN, pattern, or password before you can unpin it. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Open the app you want your child to use.
steps.content: Open the app you want your child to use. If the app is already running in the background, you can move on to the next step.

steps.title: Open the app switcher.
steps.content: Open the app switcher. If the app is already open, scroll to it in the app switcher.

steps.title: Swipe up from the middle of the screen and hold.
steps.content: Swipe up from the middle of the screen and hold. This will open your Overview. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the app's icon at the top of the image.
steps.content: Tap the app's icon at the top of the image.

steps.title: Select Pin.
steps.content: Select Pin . This will pin the app to your screen, so you can only use that app and can't exit it. [14] X Research source Unlike iPhone, you cannot adjust the touch, keyboard, or motion settings. The app will be fully usable, but your child won't be able to exit the app with the app pinned. If you're on Android 8.1 or below, you'll need to tap the Overview button with a square icon, then swipe up and select Pin .

steps.title: Unpin the screen depending on which navigation system you have active.
steps.content: Unpin the screen depending on which navigation system you have active. If you have button navigation active, press the recent and back keys simultaneously. If you're using gesture navigation, swipe up and hold.
